description: Home Credit Default Risk Random Forest K Fold Cross Validation This notebook shows a simple random forest approach to the Home Credit Default Risk problem A K Fold cross validation is used to avoid overfitting Loans data model It s good to keep in mind Home Credit loans data model to know how to join the different tables Home Credit loans data model https storage googleapis com kaggle media competitions home credit home credit png Read data Features selection The feature selection has been done using the most important features resulting of Will Koehrsen automated features generation https www kaggle com willkoehrsen applied automated feature engineering basics notebook Thanks to him for his awesome notebook and introduction to Featuretools https www featuretools com and Deep Feature Synthesis http www jmaxkanter com static papers DSAA DSM 2015 pdf method First let s aggregate the features coming from the credit bureau file in the main loans table Next let s generate the features coming from the installments data To do so We compute first the minimum of installment payments in the previous applications table The rational is to catch the loans where one payment has been missed or was very low Then we merge the aggregates of all minimum installment payments across all previous loans Finally let s add all the base features from the main loan table which don t need aggregation We fill the missing values with their average Random Forest model K Fold cross validation  Example sample of 3 loans Min payment for all previous loans Example SK ID CURR 365597 Sum and mean of minimum payments across all previous loans Example SK ID CURR 365597 Example SK ID CURR 365597 Initialize useful lists the plot axes Plot ROC for each K Fold compute AUC scores Plot the luck line Plot the mean ROC Plot the standard deviation around the mean ROC Fine tune and show the plot
